_header: All Christian men both more and less
_description: The ‘expanded version’ of the Northern Passion

BodRawPoe175.First Lines:
Alle cristen men both more & lesþat in þis werld her
                    wonand es…
BodRawPoe175.Last Lines:
…þat we may when we hethen wendeByde in blys with outen
                    ende
BodRawPoe175.Editions:
Heuser,  Wilhelm,  and  Frances Allen Foster, eds.  
             The Northern Passion (Supplement).
EETS
         o.s. 183 (1930); repr. 1971: 51-142.

BLHar4196.First Lines: All cristen men both more and lesþat in þis werld here wonand es…
BLHar4196.Last Lines: …þat we may when we heuin wendeByde in blis with owten ende
BLHar4196.Note: Preceded by Latin, “Passio domini nostri ihesu cristi secundum Marcum Matheum Lucam & Iohannem”; ends “Amen.”
BLHar4196.Attributed Title: Feria vi In parasiue domini (rubric, f. 67rb)
BLHar4196.Editions:
Morris,  Richard,
                        ed.  
             Legends of the Holy Rood, Symbols of the Passion, and
                Cross-Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 46 (1871); repr. 1973: 62-86 (Cross story only).
Foster,  Frances Allen,
                        ed.  
             The Northern Passion.
EETS
         o.s. 145, 147 (1913, 1916); repr. 1971: 45.
Nevanlinna,  Sara. 
             The Northern Homily Cycle: The Expanded Version in MSS Harley 4196 and Cotton Tiberius E.vii.
             3 vols. 
             Memoires de la Societé Neophilologique de Helsinki.
         Helsinki. 38 (1972); 41 (1973); and 43 (1984): II.168.
